p: Bacterial cellulose was obtained from strains of Komagataeibacter sp. GH1 isolated and genetically characterized by our scientific team [ 33] and Gluconacetobacter hansenii ATCC 23769, obtained from the American Type Culture Collection. Strains were grown on Hestrin-Scharmm (BTL, Lodz, Poland) medium which contains (amounts in gL −1): 20, D-dextrose; 5, yeast extract; 5, peptone; 2.7, Na 2HPO 4; 1.5, citric acid; pH 6.0 [ 34]. The cultivation was carried out under static conditions at a 28 °C for seven days. After this time, BC was taken from the liquid surface and dedicated to further research.
